issue.title: [CF 626] uidropdownmenu
issue.body:
Submitted Via

Curse Client 5.1.1.430, Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1

Installed Version

r617

Description

Since an update yesterday, an odd dropdown arrow appears offcenter left in the middle of my screen. If I click on it I get the following error. Happens with all characters, etc. Date: 2012-09-17 09:09:08 ID: 1 Error occured in: Global Count: 1 Message: ..\FrameXML\UIDropDownMenu.lua line 789: attempt to concatenate a nil value Debug: ..\FrameXML\UIDropDownMenu.lua:789: ToggleDropDownMenu() [string "*:OnClick"]:1: [string "*:OnClick"]:1 Locals: level = 1 value = nil dropDownFrame = <unnamed> { 0 = <userdata> Text = UIParentText { } wrapTooltips = 1 initialize = <function> defined @Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Components\IconModules\IconModule_IconEditorLoader\module.lua:32 Button = UIParentButton { } Right = UIParentRight { } Middle = UIParentMiddle { } Left = UIParentLeft { } } anchorName = nil xOffset = nil yOffset = nil menuList = nil button = nil autoHideDelay = nil listFrame = DropDownList1 { Show = <function> defined =[C]:-1 dropdown = CompactUnitFrameProfilesGeneralOptionsFrameHealthTextDropdown { } showTimer = 2 isCounting = 1 0 = <userdata> numButtons = 4 maxWidth = 131.02228213552 } listFrameName = } (*temporary) = <function> defined =[C]:-1 (*temporary) = <function> defined @Interface\FrameXML\UIDropDownMenu.lua:23 (*temporary) = <unnamed> { 0 = <userdata> } (*temporary) = "openmenu" (*temporary) = <unnamed> { 0 = <userdata> Text = UIParentText { } wrapTooltips = 1 initialize = <function> defined comments.body:
Not sure why you are able to see it considering it has no anchors and no size defined, but give r618 a shot and see if its fixed.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
